title: Sunday Boredom Busters, June 3rd
content: It's opening weekend at the outdoor city pools and aquatic centers in Sioux Falls.  Cool-off for the summer at Drake Springs Aquatic Center, Frank Olson Pool, Kuehn Pool, Laurel Oak Aquatic Center, McKennan Wading Pool, Pioneer Spray Pool and Terrace Park Aquatic Center.  It's Pool Appreciaton Night at Terrace Park with free admission starting at 6:30 p.m.        The Western Spirit and Cowboy Festival wraps up Sunday in Trent, SD.  Activities include horse trail rides at 8 a.m., a cowboy church service at 10 a.m. followed by a brunch at 11 a.m.   Wheel Jam at the South Dakota State Fairgrounds in Huron, SD includes a pancake feed at 7:30 a.m., carnival rides starting at 10 a.m., a truck show at 11 a.m. and a motorcycle show at noon.   Buffalo Days in Luverne wrap up Sunday with a baseball tournament plus a pie and ice cream social in the afternoon.   Sunset Days in Crooks wind up with a community breakfast at 8 a.m., an outdoor worship service at 10 a.m. and a bean bag tournament at 2 p.m.     The Sioux Falls Municipal Band begins another season of free Sunday outdoor concerts.  Sunday's performance is at 3 p.m. at the McKennan Park Bandshell.     Pack a picnic lunch and head out to Strawbale Winery in Renner for Sangria Sunday.    Enjoy live music and South Dakota summer wines from 1-4 p.m.  Admission is $5 a person or $10 per carload.      Inspiration Hills in Inwood, Iowa is hosting Camp Sunday.  Meet the summer camp staff and enjoy new camp activities from 3-5 p.m.  Admission is free.      Author Brian Stroh is hosting a book release event during the 9 a.m. service at Hillcrest Church in Sioux Falls.  Stroh's new book is Bridge the Gap: How One Church Partnered with a Public School.  Hillcrest Church is located at 4301 E. 26th Street.   The group Everchanged is hosting their new album release at Celebration United Methodist Church in Brandon, SD.  The concert begins at 7 p.m.  Admission is free.   The Canaries baseball team takes on the Lincoln Saltdogs at Sioux Falls Stadium.  First pitch is at 1:05 p.m.     Films Playing at the Wells Fargo CineDome at the Washington Pavilion include Mysteries of China, Meerkats and In Saturn's Rings.   New summer movie releases playing at a theater near you include Adrift, rated PG-13, and Action Point and Upgrade, both rated R.   © 2018 KELOLAND TV. All Rights Reserved.
